title: Droven dagger
data:
- - *For the weapon in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") and [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), see [dark elven dagger (SLASH'EM)](/wiki/Dark_elven_dagger_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Dark elven dagger (SLASH'EM)").*
  - *For the weapon in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), see [dark elven dagger (EvilHack)](/wiki/Dark_elven_dagger_\(EvilHack\) "Dark elven dagger (EvilHack)").*

| )                |                                                         |
| ---------------- | ------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name             | droven dagger                                           |
| Appearance       | dagger                                                  |
| Damage vs. small | 1d8                                                     |
| Damage vs. large | 1d6                                                     |
| To-hit bonus     | +4                                                      |
| Weapon skill     | [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger")                         |
| Size             | [one-handed](/wiki/One-handed "One-handed")             |
| Base price       | 12 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid") (+10/positive enchant) |
| Weight           | [5](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                              |
| Material         | [obsidian](/wiki/Obsidian "Obsidian")                   |

A **droven dagger** is a type of [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"). It is a [stackable](/wiki/Stackable "Stackable") one-handed weapon that can be wielded in melee and thrown, and uses the [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger") [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill"). It has a [default material](/wiki/Object_materials_\(dNetHack\) "Object materials (dNetHack)") of [obsidian](/wiki/Obsidian "Obsidian"), and appears as a "dagger" with its material displayed when [unidentified](/wiki/Identification "Identification").

## Generation

Droven daggers are not randomly generated. [Drow](/wiki/Drow_\(starting_race\)#dNetHack "Drow (starting race)") [heroes](/wiki/Hero "Hero") start with knowledge of the droven dagger, and drow in roles that start with [athames](/wiki/Athame "Athame"), daggers or [knives](/wiki/Knives "Knives") will instead receive droven daggers.

Several [drow](/wiki/Drow_\(monster_attribute\) "Drow (monster attribute)") can be [generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") droven daggers:

- [A'salom](/wiki/A%27salom "A'salom") always generates with two separate droven daggers.
- [Hedrow wizards](/wiki/Hedrow_wizard "Hedrow wizard"), [hedrow master-wizards](/wiki/Hedrow_master-wizard "Hedrow master-wizard") and [hedrow blademasters](/wiki/Hedrow_blademaster "Hedrow blademaster") always generate with a droven dagger.
- [Houseless drow](/index.php?title=Houseless_drow\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Houseless drow (page does not exist)") have a 1⁄6 chance of generating with a droven dagger.
- [Y-cultist fighters](/index.php?title=Y-cultist_fighter\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Y-cultist fighter (page does not exist)") and other drow that do not have a defined starting inventory have a 1⁄2 chance of generating with a droven dagger, along with an independent 1⁄3 chance of a weapon kit that has two separate droven daggers.
- [Y-cultist wizards](/index.php?title=Y-cultist_wizard\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Y-cultist wizard (page does not exist)") always generate with a droven dagger.
- [Y-cultist matrons](/index.php?title=Y-cultist_matron\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Y-cultist matron (page does not exist)") have a 1⁄20 chance of generating with 3 separate droven daggers.
- [Drow matrons](/wiki/Drow_matron "Drow matron"), [drow matron-mothers](/wiki/Drow_matron-mother "Drow matron-mother"), and [yochlol](/wiki/Yochlol "Yochlol") generated in unearthly drow form are always generated with a droven dagger, along with an independent 1⁄20 chance of a weapon kit that has 3 separate droven daggers.
- [Deminymphs](/wiki/Deminymph "Deminymph") that are randomly generated outside of the [Drow Healer quest](/index.php?title=Drow_Healer_quest\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Drow Healer quest (page does not exist)") or the Lost Cities have an effective 1⁄320 chance of being given a madperson kit with a droven dagger that has an enchantment of +1 to +3.

Droven daggers are generated in a few [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") branches:

- In the [Drow Noble quest](/wiki/Drow_Noble_quest "Drow Noble quest"), six droven daggers are randomly generated on the locate level at level creation, and three droven daggers are randomly generated on each of the lower filler levels at level creation.
- In the [Hedrow Noble quest](/wiki/Hedrow_Noble_quest "Hedrow Noble quest"), three droven daggers are generated on the home level, locate level and each of the lower filler levels at level creation.
- In the [Hedrow shared quest](/index.php?title=Hedrow_shared_quest\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Hedrow shared quest (page does not exist)"), three droven daggers are generated on the upper filler level at level creation.
- In the [Anachrononaut quest](/wiki/Anachrononaut_quest "Anachrononaut quest") and [Android quest](/index.php?title=Android_quest\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Android quest (page does not exist)"), three droven daggers are randomly generated on each of the lower filler levels at level creation.

* *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Droven_dagger\&action=edit)*

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Droven dagger

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
For the weapon in SLASH'EM, SpliceHack and SlashTHEM, see dark elven dagger (SLASH'EM).
For the weapon in EvilHack, see dark elven dagger (EvilHack).
)  
Name droven dagger
Appearance dagger
Damage vs. small 1d8
Damage vs. large 1d6
To-hit bonus +4
Weapon skill dagger
Size one-handed
Base price 12 zm
(+10/positive
enchant)
Weight 5
Material obsidian

A droven dagger is a type of weapon that appears in dNetHack, notdNetHack and notnotdNetHack. It is a stackable one-handed weapon that can be wielded in melee and thrown, and uses the dagger skill. It has a default material of obsidian, and appears as a "dagger" with its material displayed when unidentified.

Generation

Droven daggers are not randomly generated. Drow heroes start with knowledge of the droven dagger, and drow in roles that start with athames, daggers or knives will instead receive droven daggers.

Several drow can be generated with droven daggers:

  • A'salom always generates with two separate droven daggers.
  • Hedrow wizards, hedrow master-wizards and hedrow blademasters always generate with a droven dagger.
  • Houseless drow have a 1⁄6 chance of generating with a droven dagger.
  • Y-cultist fighters and other drow that do not have a defined starting inventory have a 1⁄2 chance of generating with a droven dagger, along with an independent 1⁄3 chance of a weapon kit that has two separate droven daggers.
  • Y-cultist wizards always generate with a droven dagger.
  • Y-cultist matrons have a 1⁄20 chance of generating with 3 separate droven daggers.
  • Drow matrons, drow matron-mothers, and yochlol generated in unearthly drow form are always generated with a droven dagger, along with an independent 1⁄20 chance of a weapon kit that has 3 separate droven daggers.
  • Deminymphs that are randomly generated outside of the Drow Healer quest or the Lost Cities have an effective 1⁄320 chance of being given a madperson kit with a droven dagger that has an enchantment of +1 to +3.

Droven daggers are generated in a few quest branches:

  • In the Drow Noble quest, six droven daggers are randomly generated on the locate level at level creation, and three droven daggers are randomly generated on each of the lower filler levels at level creation.
  • In the Hedrow Noble quest, three droven daggers are generated on the home level, locate level and each of the lower filler levels at level creation.
  • In the Hedrow shared quest, three droven daggers are generated on the upper filler level at level creation.
  • In the Anachrononaut quest and Android quest, three droven daggers are randomly generated on each of the lower filler levels at level creation.
This page is a stub. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by expanding this page.

A '''droven dagger''' is a type of [[weapon]] that appears in [[dNetHack]], [[notdNetHack]] and [[notnotdNetHack]]. It is a [[stackable]] one-handed weapon that can be wielded in melee and thrown, and uses the [[dagger]] [[skill]]. It has a [[Object materials (dNetHack)|default material]] of [[obsidian]], and appears as a "dagger" with its material displayed when [[Identification|unidentified]].

==Generation==
Droven daggers are not randomly generated. [[Drow (starting race)#dNetHack|Drow]] [[hero]]es start with knowledge of the droven dagger, and drow in roles that start with [[athame]]s, daggers or [[knives]] will instead receive droven daggers.

Several [[Drow (monster attribute)|drow]] can be [[Monster starting inventory|generated with]] droven daggers:

* [[A'salom]] always generates with two separate droven daggers.
* [[Hedrow wizard]]s, [[hedrow master-wizard]]s and [[hedrow blademaster]]s always generate with a droven dagger.
* [[Houseless drow]] have a {{frac|6}} chance of generating with a droven dagger.
* [[Y-cultist fighter]]s and other drow that do not have a defined starting inventory have a {{frac|2}} chance of generating with a droven dagger, along with an independent {{frac|3}} chance of a weapon kit that has two separate droven daggers.
* [[Y-cultist wizard]]s always generate with a droven dagger.
* [[Y-cultist matron]]s have a {{frac|20}} chance of generating with 3 separate droven daggers.
* [[Drow matron]]s, [[drow matron-mother]]s, and [[yochlol]] generated in unearthly drow form are always generated with a droven dagger, along with an independent {{frac|20}} chance of a weapon kit that has 3 separate droven daggers.
* [[Deminymph]]s that are randomly generated outside of the [[Drow Healer quest]] or the Lost Cities have an effective {{frac|320}} chance of being given a madperson kit with a droven dagger that has an enchantment of +1 to +3.

Droven daggers are generated in a few [[quest]] branches:

* In the [[Drow Noble quest]], six droven daggers are randomly generated on the locate level at level creation, and three droven daggers are randomly generated on each of the lower filler levels at level creation.
* In the [[Hedrow Noble quest]], three droven daggers are generated on the home level, locate level and each of the lower filler levels at level creation.
* In the [[Hedrow shared quest]], three droven daggers are generated on the upper filler level at level creation.
* In the [[Anachrononaut quest]] and [[Android quest]], three droven daggers are randomly generated on each of the lower filler levels at level creation.
